description: Nikola Petrak quietly suppresses a proposed surveillance clampdown against restored citizens and allows the planned 'data strike' to proceed, enabling activists to coordinate disruption without interference.
Thousands join a citywide 'data strike,' deliberately scrambling or erasing their BCI records. The system struggles to track identities, disrupting public services and alerting authorities.
As transit, health, and welfare systems malfunction due to missing BCI profiles, solidarity spreads; residents help each other navigate chaos and openly challenge BCI authority.
Council divisions deepen as Directorate demands harsh controls while Harmonists urge negotiation; officials acknowledge the system's growing instability.
Council, under mounting public and internal pressure, announces its willingness to negotiate directly with citizen representatives. Murals and symbols of defiance flourish across the city.
